basic_information.scholarship_name: Dr. Kaye SearsÂ’ Honorary Scholarship for Professionalism

description: Scholarship Mission: To provide scholarship assistance to students within the College of Education & Professional Studies who is a major in Human Environmental Sciences. Eligibility Requirements Be an active member in a professional organization related to our field: Central Council on Family Relations (CCRF), Advocates for Children and Families (ACF), or Phi Upsilon Omicron Minimum 2.75 GPA Must be a declared major in one of the following: Child Development, Marriage & Family, Gerontology, Infant Child Specialist, Family Life Educator, Marriage & Family Therapist Preference will be given to graduate applicants Must submit essay demonstrating character, integrity, professionalism and financial need Must be a junior, senior, or graduate student at time of distribution Selection Process Recipients of the scholarship will be selected by a departmental committee Award Requirements Must be enrolled in the upcoming fall and spring semester to receive award Attendance at an awards banquet is required for all recipients Recipients must write a thank you letter to the donors of the scholarship
